thread.title: Won't allow celebration of Godse's death anniversary in Mumbai: Congress | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Won't allow celebration of Godse's death anniversary in Mumbai: Congress | Deccan Chronicle

author: PTI
title: Won't allow celebration of Godse's death anniversary in Mumbai: Congress | Deccan Chronicle
text:
PTI | October 21, 2015, 19.12 pm Nathuram Godse. (Photo: Video grab) Mumbai: Congress in Maharastra on Wednesday said it will not allow anybody to celebrate the death anniversary of Nathuram Godse, Mahatma Gandhi's assassin, on November 15.
"Congress will not allow such insult to the father of the nation. Godse was responsible for the first act of terror in the independent India," Leader of Opposition in the Maharashtra Assembly Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil said.
The senior Congress leader asked the BJP-led state government and the Centre to intervene and stop the event.
Hindu Mahasabha had announced that it would celebrate November 15, the day Godse was hanged as "Balidan Din" (sacrifice day).
